column4: how can I see, what kind of graphiccard i have and what kind of slot it uses i mean PCIe or whatever?
lspci | grep -i vga
thank you
it doesnt tell me what slot it uses (PCI/AGP or whatever)?
maybe "sudo lshw" or "sudo dmidecode"
ok thakn you
look at the complete lspci output
ok thanks
you should see something like 00:01.0 PCI bridge: ALi Corporation PCI Express Root Port
does this mean that i REALLY have a PCI-e slot: 00:01.0 PCI bridge: Intel Corporation 82G33/G31/P35/P31 Express PCI Express Root Port (rev 02)
yep; you can consult the otherboard manual too (online)
do I need to consult the otherboard manual if I have this PCI Express thing listed? i mean, can i allready be sure that i have an PCI-e thingy on my mainboard?
i would be sure
ok thank you very much ;D ill order my christmas present now then ;DD
find out what xchat uses ( aspell; ispell another program) then install the dict ( i.e. aspell-de )
thank you very much :)
how do i find that out? what program it uses?
http://xchat.org/spell/
thank you :D
do i have to restart xchat and do i have to set the dictionary to use somewhere?
i really do not know xchat well enough
ok thank you :)
it still underlines the words ;( even after installing aspell-de and restarting xchat
